    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet()

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(int[] layers)
        Constructs a new neural net with the given layer definition.
        Parameters:
        layers - the layer definition for the neural net. The length of the array defines the number of layers, while each integer defines the number of nodes.

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(java.util.ArrayList<Matrix> weights)
        Constructs a new neural net with the given weights definitions.
        Parameters:
        weights - the list of matrices that define the connections for each layer. The 0th matrix defines the connections between the input layer and the first hidden layer, the 1st matrix defines the connections between the first and second hidden layers, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • initWeights

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Matrix> initWeights(int[] layers)
        Randomly returns a list of matrices, which can be used to represent the weights for each layer.
        Parameters:
        layers - the layer definition
        Returns:
        the list of matrices that define the connections between the layers in the net

        Returns:

      • feedForward

        public Matrix feedForward(Matrix x)
                   throws DimensionMismatchException
        Feeds inputs into the neural net and returns a result vector
        Parameters:
        x - a vertical vector of inputs
        Returns:
        a vertical vector, containing the results
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the input array is not the right size

      • feedForwardActivations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Matrix> feedForwardActivations(Matrix X)
                                                   throws DimensionMismatchException
        Feeds inputs into the neural net and returns the activations of each layer.
        Parameters:
        X - a matrix representing multiple vertical vectors of inputs
        Returns:
        the activations
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the input vector is not the right size

      • backpropagate

        public double[] backpropagate(Matrix X,
                              Matrix Y,
                              double lambda)
                       throws DimensionMismatchException
        Does the backpropagate process once on the neural net. Specifically, it runs a feedforward to find the activations, and backpropagates to find the error on each node. Finally, it corrects those errors in each node using gradient descent.
        Parameters:
        X - the inputs
        Y - the expected outputs
        lambda - the regularisation factor
        Returns:
        the costs of each of the test cases
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the sizes are not correct

      • cost

        public double cost(double[] outputs,
                   double[] expectedOutputs,
                   double lambda)
            throws DimensionMismatchException
        Returns the result of the cost function J(theta).
        Parameters:
        outputs - the answer given by the neural net
        expectedOutputs - the expected answer
        lambda - the regularisation parameter
        Returns:
        the cost
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the input array is not the right size, or when the answer vector is not the right size

      • cost

        public double cost(double[] outputs,
                   double[] expectedOutputs)
            throws DimensionMismatchException

        Parameters:
        outputs - the answer given by the neural net
        expectedOutputs - the expected answer
        Returns:
        the cost
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the input array is not the right size, or when the answer vector is not the right size

      • costMulti

        public double[] costMulti(Matrix outputs,
                          Matrix expectedOutputs,
                          double lambda)
                   throws DimensionMismatchException
        Returns the results of the cost function J(theta), for multiple examples.
        Parameters:
        outputs - the answers given by the neural net
        expectedOutputs - the expected answers
        lambda - the regularisation factor
        Returns:
        the costs
        Throws:
        DimensionMismatchException - thrown when the inputs are not the same sizes
